title-part.text: MAGNETIC OR ELECTROSTATIC SEPARATION OF SOLID MATERIALS FROM SOLID MATERIALS OR FLUIDS

reference.text: filters making use of electricity or magnetism B01D35/06; separating isotopes B01D59/00; combinations of magnetic or electrostatic separation with separation of solids by other means B03B, B07B; separating sheets from piles B65H3/00; magnets or magnet coils per se H01F

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

CPC-specific-text.text: High gradient magnetic separation

title-part.text: Pretreatment specially adapted for magnetic separation
by chemical treatment imparting magnetic properties to the material to be separated, e.g. roasting, reduction, oxidation
acting directly on the substance being separated
Separation using Meissner effect, i.e. deflection of superconductive particles in a magnetic field
Separation using Lorentz force, i.e. deflection of electrically charged particles in a magnetic field
with circulating matrix or matrix elements
rotating, e.g. of the carousel type

CPC-specific-text.text: using permanent magnets
using coils
superconductive

title-part.text: Open gradient magnetic separators, i.e. separators in which the gap is unobstructed, characterised by the configuration of the gap
with the material carriers in the form of trays or with tables

CPC-specific-text.text: with rotating annular or disc-shaped material carriers

title-part.text: with material carriers in the form of belts
in the form of belts, e.g. cross-belt type
with material carried by oscillating fields
with material carried by travelling fields, e.g. generated by stationary magnetic coils
with material carried by travelling fields
obtained by a rotating magnetic drum

CPC-specific-text.text: with associated accumulation indicator, e.g. Hall sensor
with associated cleaning means, e.g. retractable non-magnetic sleeve
disposed at the inner circumference of a recipient, e.g. magnetic drain bolt
disposed at the outer circumference of a recipient

title-part.text: Combinations with other devices, not otherwise provided for
acting on the medium containing the substance being separated, e.g. magnetogravimetric-, magnetohydrostatic-, or magnetohydrodynamic separation

reference.text: sink-float separation using heavy liquids or suspensions B03B5/30

title-part.text: Separating dispersed particles from gases or vapour, e.g. air, by electrostatic effect

reference.text: use of electrostatic separators in combination with exhausts of machines or internal combustion machines F01N3/01

title-part.text: Pretreatment of the gases prior to electrostatic precipitation
Conditioning by chemical additives, e.g. with SO3
by acoustic or electromagnetic energy, e.g. ultra-violet light
Combinations of electrostatic separation with other processes, not otherwise provided for

CPC-specific-text.text: Amassing particles by electric fields, e.g. agglomeration

title-part.text: Plant or installations having external electricity supply

CPC-specific-text.text: Combinations of electrostatic separators, e.g. in parallel or in series, stacked separators, dry-wet separator combinations

title-part.text: characterised by presence of stationary tube electrodes
characterised by presence of stationary flat electrodes arranged with their flat surfaces parallel to the gas stream
characterised by presence of stationary flat electrodes arranged with their flat surfaces at right angles to the gas stream
characterised by presence of electrodes moving during separating action
characterised by separation of ionising and collecting stations
characterised by the additional use of mechanical effects, e.g. gravity
Plant or installations without electricity supply, e.g. using electrets
in which electrostatic charge is generated by passage of the gases, i.e. tribo-electricity
Transportable units, e.g. for cleaning room air

reference.text: room air-conditioners having an electrostatic separating stage F24F

title-part.text: Constructional details or accessories or operation thereof
Controlling flow of gases or vapour

CPC-specific-text.text: by static mechanical means, e.g. deflector
located before the filter
located after the filter
located in the filter, e.g. special shape of the electrodes
by other than static mechanical means, e.g. internal ventilator or recycler

title-part.text: Particle charging or ionising stations, e.g. using electric discharge, radioactive radiation, flames

reference.text: electrode constructions B03C3/40; ionising gases H05H

CPC-specific-text.text: using radiation
using flames
specially adapted for heat exchange with the gas stream

title-part.text: Catch- space electrodes, e.g. slotted-box form
Use of special materials other than liquids

CPC-specific-text.text: by using friction, e.g. by brushes or sliding elements
Electricity supply or control systems therefor

title-part.text: by using a mechanical vibrator, e.g. rapping gear

CPC-specific-text.text: ; by using impact
Drive-transmitting devices therefor, e.g. insulated shafts
Electricity supply or control systems therefor
with electromagnetic rappers
with pneumatic rappers
with free falling masses, e.g. dropped metal balls

title-part.text: by gas or solid particle blasting

CPC-specific-text.text: by travelling or oscillating electric fields, e.g. electric field curtains

reference.text: electrostatic non-mechanical conveyors in general B65G54/02

title-part.text: Separating dispersed particles from liquids by electrostatic effect

CPC-specific-text.text: flocculation or agglomeration of electric particles induced by electric field B01D21/0009; microreactors B01J19/0093
; treatment of microorganisms and apparatus therefor C12M1/42, C12N13/00, C12Q1/24; analysis of biomaterial by electrical means G01N33/48707

note.note-paragraph: In this group, the following term is used with the meaning indicated:"separating" means dimensional modifications of particle-liquid distributions, e.g. particle immobilisation, caging, translational or rotational motion

CPC-specific-text.text: Dielectrophoresis, i.e. dielectric particles migrating towards the region of highest field strength
Non-uniform field separators
using high-gradient differential dielectric separation, i.e. using a dielectric matrix polarised by an external field
using open-gradient differential dielectric separation, i.e. using electrodes of special shapes for non-uniform field creation, e.g. Fluid Integrated Circuit [FIC]
using travelling electric fields, i.e. travelling wave dielectrophoresis [TWD]

title-part.text: Separating solids from solids by electrostatic effect

CPC-specific-text.text: Pretreatment of the solids prior to electrostatic separation
Charging without electricity supply, e.g. by tribo-electricity, pyroelectricity
Non-uniform field separators
using travelling or oscillating electric fields

title-part.text: with material carriers in the form of trays, troughs, or tables
with material carriers in the form of belts
Electrostatic separation not provided for in a single preceding main group
Separation by high-voltage electrical fields, not provided for in other groups of this subclass
Details of magnetic or electrostatic separation
Ionising electrode has multiple serrated ends or parts
Cleaning the device by burning the trapped particles
Magnetic separating gases form gases, e.g. oxygen from air
Magnetic separation whereby the particles are suspended in a liquid
Magnetic separation whereby the particles to be separated are in solid form
characterised by the magnetical field, special shape or generation
for measuring or calculating parameters, efficiency, etc.
Parts being easily removable for cleaning purposes
for use in or with vehicles
Checking the quality of the result or the well-functioning of the device
